column.name: aid
column.remarks: Primary Key: Unique actions ID.

column.name: type
column.remarks: The object that that action acts on (node, user, comment, system or custom types.)

column.name: callback
column.remarks: The callback function that executes when the action runs.

column.name: parameters
column.remarks: Parameters to be passed to the callback function.

column.name: label
column.remarks: Label of the action.

column.name: aid
column.remarks: Primary Key: Unique authmap ID.

column.name: uid
column.remarks: User’s users.uid.

column.name: authname
column.remarks: Unique authentication name.

column.name: module
column.remarks: Module which is controlling the authentication.

column.name: bid
column.remarks: Primary Key: Unique batch ID.

column.name: token
column.remarks: A string token generated against the current user’s session id and the batch id, used to ensure that only the user who submitted the batch can effectively access it.

column.name: timestamp
column.remarks: A Unix timestamp indicating when this batch was submitted for processing. Stale batches are purged at cron time.

column.name: batch
column.remarks: A serialized array containing the processing data for the batch.

column.name: bid
column.remarks: Primary Key: Unique block ID.

column.name: module
column.remarks: The module from which the block originates; for example, ’user’ for the Who’s Online block, and ’block’ for any custom blocks.

column.name: delta
column.remarks: Unique ID for block within a module.

column.name: theme
column.remarks: The theme under which the block settings apply.

column.name: status
column.remarks: Block enabled status. (1 = enabled, 0 = disabled)

column.name: weight
column.remarks: Block weight within region.

column.name: region
column.remarks: Theme region within which the block is set.

column.name: custom
column.remarks: Flag to indicate how users may control visibility of the block. (0 = Users cannot control, 1 = On by default, but can be hidden, 2 = Hidden by default, but can be shown)

column.name: visibility
column.remarks: Flag to indicate how to show blocks on pages. (0 = Show on all pages except listed pages, 1 = Show only on listed pages, 2 = Use custom PHP code to determine visibility)

column.name: pages
column.remarks: Contents of the "Pages" block; contains either a list of paths on which to include/exclude the block or PHP code, depending on "visibility" setting.

column.name: title
column.remarks: Custom title for the block. (Empty string will use block default title, <none> will remove the title, text will cause block to use specified title.)

column.name: cache
column.remarks: Binary flag to indicate block cache mode. (-2: Custom cache, -1: Do not cache, 1: Cache per role, 2: Cache per user, 4: Cache per page, 8: Block cache global) See DRUPAL_CACHE_* constants in ../includes/common.inc for more detailed information.

column.name: bid
column.remarks: The block’s block.bid.

column.name: body
column.remarks: Block contents.

column.name: info
column.remarks: Block description.

column.name: format
column.remarks: The filter_format.format of the block body.

column.name: module
column.remarks: The block’s origin module, from block.module.

column.name: delta
column.remarks: The block’s unique delta within module, from block.delta.

column.name: type
column.remarks: The machine-readable name of this type from node_type.type.

column.name: module
column.remarks: The block’s origin module, from block.module.

column.name: delta
column.remarks: The block’s unique delta within module, from block.delta.

column.name: rid
column.remarks: The user’s role ID from users_roles.rid.

column.name: iid
column.remarks: Primary Key: unique ID for IP addresses.

column.name: ip
column.remarks: IP address

column.name: cid
column.remarks: Primary Key: Unique cache ID.

column.name: data
column.remarks: A collection of data to cache.

column.name: expire
column.remarks: A Unix timestamp indicating when the cache entry should expire, or 0 for never.

column.name: created
column.remarks: A Unix timestamp indicating when the cache entry was created.

column.name: serialized
column.remarks: A flag to indicate whether content is serialized (1) or not (0).

column.name: cid
column.remarks: Primary Key: Unique cache ID.

column.name: data
column.remarks: A collection of data to cache.

column.name: expire
column.remarks: A Unix timestamp indicating when the cache entry should expire, or 0 for never.

column.name: created
column.remarks: A Unix timestamp indicating when the cache entry was created.

column.name: serialized
column.remarks: A flag to indicate whether content is serialized (1) or not (0).

column.name: cid
column.remarks: Primary Key: Unique cache ID.

column.name: data
column.remarks: A collection of data to cache.

column.name: expire
column.remarks: A Unix timestamp indicating when the cache entry should expire, or 0 for never.

column.name: created
column.remarks: A Unix timestamp indicating when the cache entry was created.

column.name: serialized
column.remarks: A flag to indicate whether content is serialized (1) or not (0).

column.name: cid
column.remarks: Primary Key: Unique cache ID.

column.name: data
column.remarks: A collection of data to cache.

column.name: expire
column.remarks: A Unix timestamp indicating when the cache entry should expire, or 0 for never.

column.name: created
column.remarks: A Unix timestamp indicating when the cache entry was created.

column.name: serialized
column.remarks: A flag to indicate whether content is serialized (1) or not (0).

column.name: cid
column.remarks: Primary Key: Unique cache ID.

column.name: data
column.remarks: A collection of data to cache.

column.name: expire
column.remarks: A Unix timestamp indicating when the cache entry should expire, or 0 for never.

column.name: created
column.remarks: A Unix timestamp indicating when the cache entry was created.

column.name: serialized
column.remarks: A flag to indicate whether content is serialized (1) or not (0).

column.name: cid
column.remarks: Primary Key: Unique cache ID.

column.name: data
column.remarks: A collection of data to cache.

column.name: expire
column.remarks: A Unix timestamp indicating when the cache entry should expire, or 0 for never.

column.name: created
column.remarks: A Unix timestamp indicating when the cache entry was created.

column.name: serialized
column.remarks: A flag to indicate whether content is serialized (1) or not (0).

column.name: cid
column.remarks: Primary Key: Unique cache ID.

column.name: data
column.remarks: A collection of data to cache.

column.name: expire
column.remarks: A Unix timestamp indicating when the cache entry should expire, or 0 for never.

column.name: created
column.remarks: A Unix timestamp indicating when the cache entry was created.

column.name: serialized
column.remarks: A flag to indicate whether content is serialized (1) or not (0).

column.name: cid
column.remarks: Primary Key: Unique cache ID.

column.name: data
column.remarks: A collection of data to cache.

column.name: expire
column.remarks: A Unix timestamp indicating when the cache entry should expire, or 0 for never.

column.name: created
column.remarks: A Unix timestamp indicating when the cache entry was created.

column.name: serialized
column.remarks: A flag to indicate whether content is serialized (1) or not (0).

column.name: cid
column.remarks: Primary Key: Unique cache ID.

column.name: data
column.remarks: A collection of data to cache.

column.name: expire
column.remarks: A Unix timestamp indicating when the cache entry should expire, or 0 for never.

column.name: created
column.remarks: A Unix timestamp indicating when the cache entry was created.

column.name: serialized
column.remarks: A flag to indicate whether content is serialized (1) or not (0).

column.name: cid
column.remarks: Primary Key: Unique cache ID.

column.name: data
column.remarks: A collection of data to cache.

column.name: expire
column.remarks: A Unix timestamp indicating when the cache entry should expire, or 0 for never.

column.name: created
column.remarks: A Unix timestamp indicating when the cache entry was created.

column.name: serialized
column.remarks: A flag to indicate whether content is serialized (1) or not (0).

column.name: cid
column.remarks: Primary Key: Unique cache ID.

column.name: data
column.remarks: A collection of data to cache.

column.name: expire
column.remarks: A Unix timestamp indicating when the cache entry should expire, or 0 for never.

column.name: created
column.remarks: A Unix timestamp indicating when the cache entry was created.

column.name: serialized
column.remarks: A flag to indicate whether content is serialized (1) or not (0).

column.name: cid
column.remarks: Primary Key: Unique comment ID.

column.name: pid
column.remarks: The comment.cid to which this comment is a reply. If set to 0, this comment is not a reply to an existing comment.

column.name: nid
column.remarks: The node.nid to which this comment is a reply.

column.name: uid
column.remarks: The users.uid who authored the comment. If set to 0, this comment was created by an anonymous user.

column.name: subject
column.remarks: The comment title.

column.name: hostname
column.remarks: The author’s host name.

column.name: created
column.remarks: The time that the comment was created, as a Unix timestamp.

column.name: changed
column.remarks: The time that the comment was last edited, as a Unix timestamp.

column.name: status
column.remarks: The published status of a comment. (0 = Not Published, 1 = Published)

column.name: thread
column.remarks: The vancode representation of the comment’s place in a thread.

column.name: name
column.remarks: The comment author’s name. Uses users.name if the user is logged in, otherwise uses the value typed into the comment form.

column.name: mail
column.remarks: The comment author’s e-mail address from the comment form, if user is anonymous, and the ’Anonymous users may/must leave their contact information’ setting is turned on.

column.name: homepage
column.remarks: The comment author’s home page address from the comment form, if user is anonymous, and the ’Anonymous users may/must leave their contact information’ setting is turned on.

column.name: language
column.remarks: The languages.language of this comment.

column.name: format
column.remarks: The date format string.

column.name: type
column.remarks: The date format type, e.g. medium.

column.name: language
column.remarks: A languages.language for this format to be used with.

column.name: type
column.remarks: The date format type, e.g. medium.

column.name: title
column.remarks: The human readable name of the format type.

column.name: locked
column.remarks: Whether or not this is a system provided format.

column.name: dfid
column.remarks: The date format identifier.

column.name: format
column.remarks: The date format string.

column.name: type
column.remarks: The date format type, e.g. medium.

column.name: locked
column.remarks: Whether or not this format can be modified.

column.name: id
column.remarks: The primary identifier for a field

column.name: field_name
column.remarks: The name of this field. Non-deleted field names are unique, but multiple deleted fields can have the same name.

column.name: type
column.remarks: The type of this field.

column.name: module
column.remarks: The module that implements the field type.

column.name: active
column.remarks: Boolean indicating whether the module that implements the field type is enabled.

column.name: storage_type
column.remarks: The storage backend for the field.

column.name: storage_module
column.remarks: The module that implements the storage backend.

column.name: storage_active
column.remarks: Boolean indicating whether the module that implements the storage backend is enabled.

column.name: data
column.remarks: Serialized data containing the field properties that do not warrant a dedicated column.

column.name: id
column.remarks: The primary identifier for a field instance

column.name: field_id
column.remarks: The identifier of the field attached by this instance

column.name: entity_type
column.remarks: The entity type this data is attached to

column.name: bundle
column.remarks: The field instance bundle to which this row belongs, used when deleting a field instance

column.name: deleted
column.remarks: A boolean indicating whether this data item has been deleted

column.name: entity_id
column.remarks: The entity id this data is attached to

column.name: revision_id
column.remarks: The entity revision id this data is attached to, or NULL if the entity type is not versioned

column.name: language
column.remarks: The language for this data item.

column.name: delta
column.remarks: The sequence number for this data item, used for multi-value fields

column.name: entity_type
column.remarks: The entity type this data is attached to

column.name: bundle
column.remarks: The field instance bundle to which this row belongs, used when deleting a field instance

column.name: deleted
column.remarks: A boolean indicating whether this data item has been deleted

column.name: entity_id
column.remarks: The entity id this data is attached to

column.name: revision_id
column.remarks: The entity revision id this data is attached to, or NULL if the entity type is not versioned

column.name: language
column.remarks: The language for this data item.

column.name: delta
column.remarks: The sequence number for this data item, used for multi-value fields

column.name: entity_type
column.remarks: The entity type this data is attached to

column.name: bundle
column.remarks: The field instance bundle to which this row belongs, used when deleting a field instance

column.name: deleted
column.remarks: A boolean indicating whether this data item has been deleted

column.name: entity_id
column.remarks: The entity id this data is attached to

column.name: revision_id
column.remarks: The entity revision id this data is attached to, or NULL if the entity type is not versioned

column.name: language
column.remarks: The language for this data item.

column.name: delta
column.remarks: The sequence number for this data item, used for multi-value fields

column.name: field_image_fid
column.remarks: The file_managed.fid being referenced in this field.

column.name: field_image_alt
column.remarks: Alternative image text, for the image’s ’alt’ attribute.

column.name: field_image_title
column.remarks: Image title text, for the image’s ’title’ attribute.

column.name: field_image_width
column.remarks: The width of the image in pixels.

column.name: field_image_height
column.remarks: The height of the image in pixels.

column.name: entity_type
column.remarks: The entity type this data is attached to

column.name: bundle
column.remarks: The field instance bundle to which this row belongs, used when deleting a field instance

column.remarks: The language for this data item.

column.remarks: The entity type this data is attached to

column.name: language
column.remarks: The language for this data item.

column.name: delta

column.name: field_image_fid
column.remarks: The file_managed.fid being referenced in this field.

column.name: field_image_alt
column.remarks: Alternative image text, for the image’s ’alt’ attribute.

column.name: field_image_title
column.remarks: Image title text, for the image’s ’title’ attribute.

column.name: field_image_width
column.remarks: The width of the image in pixels.

column.name: field_image_height
column.remarks: The height of the image in pixels.

column.name: entity_type
column.remarks: The entity type this data is attached to

column.name: bundle
column.remarks: The field instance bundle to which this row belongs, used when deleting a field instance

column.name: deleted
column.remarks: A boolean indicating whether this data item has been deleted

column.name: entity_id
column.remarks: The entity id this data is attached to

column.name: revision_id
column.remarks: The entity revision id this data is attached to

column.name: language
column.remarks: The language for this data item.

column.name: delta
column.remarks: The sequence number for this data item, used for multi-value fields

column.name: fid
column.remarks: File ID.

column.name: uid
column.remarks: The users.uid of the user who is associated with the file.

column.name: filename
column.remarks: Name of the file with no path components. This may differ from the basename of the URI if the file is renamed to avoid overwriting an existing file.

column.name: uri
column.remarks: The URI to access the file (either local or remote).

column.name: filemime
column.remarks: The file’s MIME type.

column.name: filesize
column.remarks: The size of the file in bytes.

column.name: status
column.remarks: A field indicating the status of the file. Two status are defined in core: temporary (0) and permanent (1). Temporary files older than DRUPAL_MAXIMUM_TEMP_FILE_AGE will be removed during a cron run.

column.name: timestamp
column.remarks: UNIX timestamp for when the file was added.

column.name: fid
column.remarks: File ID.

column.name: module
column.remarks: The name of the module that is using the file.

column.name: type
column.remarks: The name of the object type in which the file is used.

column.name: id
column.remarks: The primary key of the object using the file.

column.name: count
column.remarks: The number of times this file is used by this object.

column.name: format
column.remarks: Foreign key: The filter_format.format to which this filter is assigned.

column.name: module
column.remarks: The origin module of the filter.

column.name: name
column.remarks: Name of the filter being referenced.

column.name: weight
column.remarks: Weight of filter within format.

column.name: status
column.remarks: Filter enabled status. (1 = enabled, 0 = disabled)

column.name: settings
column.remarks: A serialized array of name value pairs that store the filter settings for the specific format.

column.name: format
column.remarks: Primary Key: Unique machine name of the format.

column.name: name
column.remarks: Name of the text format (Filtered HTML).

column.name: cache
column.remarks: Flag to indicate whether format is cacheable. (1 = cacheable, 0 = not cacheable)

column.name: status
column.remarks: The status of the text format. (1 = enabled, 0 = disabled)

column.name: weight
column.remarks: Weight of text format to use when listing.

column.name: fid
column.remarks: Unique flood event ID.

column.name: event
column.remarks: Name of event (e.g. contact).

column.name: identifier
column.remarks: Identifier of the visitor, such as an IP address or hostname.

column.name: timestamp
column.remarks: Timestamp of the event.

column.name: expiration
column.remarks: Expiration timestamp. Expired events are purged on cron run.

column.name: uid
column.remarks: The users.uid that read the node nid.

column.name: nid
column.remarks: The node.nid that was read.

column.name: timestamp
column.remarks: The Unix timestamp at which the read occurred.

column.name: ieid
column.remarks: The primary identifier for an image effect.

column.name: isid
column.remarks: The image_styles.isid for an image style.

column.name: weight
column.remarks: The weight of the effect in the style.

column.name: name
column.remarks: The unique name of the effect to be executed.

column.name: data
column.remarks: The configuration data for the effect.

column.name: isid
column.remarks: The primary identifier for an image style.

column.name: name
column.remarks: The style machine name.

column.name: label
column.remarks: The style administrative name.

column.name: menu_name
column.remarks: Primary Key: Unique key for menu. This is used as a block delta so length is 32.

column.name: title
column.remarks: Menu title; displayed at top of block.

column.name: description
column.remarks: Menu description.

column.name: menu_name
column.remarks: The menu name. All links with the same menu name (such as ’navigation’) are part of the same menu.

column.name: mlid
column.remarks: The menu link ID (mlid) is the integer primary key.

column.name: plid
column.remarks: The parent link ID (plid) is the mlid of the link above in the hierarchy, or zero if the link is at the top level in its menu.

column.name: link_path
column.remarks: The Drupal path or external path this link points to.

column.name: router_path
column.remarks: For links corresponding to a Drupal path (external = 0), this connects the link to a menu_router.path for joins.

column.name: link_title
column.remarks: The text displayed for the link, which may be modified by a title callback stored in menu_router.

column.name: options
column.remarks: A serialized array of options to be passed to the url() or l() function, such as a query string or HTML attributes.

column.name: module
column.remarks: The name of the module that generated this link.

column.name: hidden
column.remarks: A flag for whether the link should be rendered in menus. (1 = a disabled menu item that may be shown on admin screens, -1 = a menu callback, 0 = a normal, visible link)

column.name: external
column.remarks: A flag to indicate if the link points to a full URL starting with a protocol, like http:// (1 = external, 0 = internal).

column.name: has_children
column.remarks: Flag indicating whether any links have this link as a parent (1 = children exist, 0 = no children).

column.name: expanded
column.remarks: Flag for whether this link should be rendered as expanded in menus - expanded links always have their child links displayed, instead of only when the link is in the active trail (1 = expanded, 0 = not expanded)

column.name: weight
column.remarks: Link weight among links in the same menu at the same depth.

column.name: depth
column.remarks: The depth relative to the top level. A link with plid == 0 will have depth == 1.

column.name: customized
column.remarks: A flag to indicate that the user has manually created or edited the link (1 = customized, 0 = not customized).

column.name: p1
column.remarks: The first mlid in the materialized path. If N = depth, then pN must equal the mlid. If depth > 1 then p(N-1) must equal the plid. All pX where X > depth must equal zero. The columns p1 .. p9 are also called the parents.

column.name: p2
column.remarks: The second mlid in the materialized path. See p1.

column.name: p3
column.remarks: The third mlid in the materialized path. See p1.

column.name: p4
column.remarks: The fourth mlid in the materialized path. See p1.

column.name: p5
column.remarks: The fifth mlid in the materialized path. See p1.

column.name: p6
column.remarks: The sixth mlid in the materialized path. See p1.

column.name: p7
column.remarks: The seventh mlid in the materialized path. See p1.

column.name: p8
column.remarks: The eighth mlid in the materialized path. See p1.

column.name: p9
column.remarks: The ninth mlid in the materialized path. See p1.

column.name: updated
column.remarks: Flag that indicates that this link was generated during the update from Drupal 5.

column.name: path
column.remarks: Primary Key: the Drupal path this entry describes

column.name: load_functions
column.remarks: A serialized array of function names (like node_load) to be called to load an object corresponding to a part of the current path.

column.name: to_arg_functions
column.remarks: A serialized array of function names (like user_uid_optional_to_arg) to be called to replace a part of the router path with another string.

column.name: access_callback
column.remarks: The callback which determines the access to this router path. Defaults to user_access.

column.name: access_arguments
column.remarks: A serialized array of arguments for the access callback.

column.name: page_callback
column.remarks: The name of the function that renders the page.

column.name: page_arguments
column.remarks: A serialized array of arguments for the page callback.

column.name: delivery_callback
column.remarks: The name of the function that sends the result of the page_callback function to the browser.

column.name: fit
column.remarks: A numeric representation of how specific the path is.

column.name: number_parts
column.remarks: Number of parts in this router path.

column.name: context
column.remarks: Only for local tasks (tabs) - the context of a local task to control its placement.

column.name: tab_parent
column.remarks: Only for local tasks (tabs) - the router path of the parent page (which may also be a local task).

column.name: tab_root
column.remarks: Router path of the closest non-tab parent page. For pages that are not local tasks, this will be the same as the path.

column.name: title
column.remarks: The title for the current page, or the title for the tab if this is a local task.

column.name: title_callback
column.remarks: A function which will alter the title. Defaults to t()

column.name: title_arguments
column.remarks: A serialized array of arguments for the title callback. If empty, the title will be used as the sole argument for the title callback.

column.name: theme_callback
column.remarks: A function which returns the name of the theme that will be used to render this page. If left empty, the default theme will be used.

column.name: theme_arguments
column.remarks: A serialized array of arguments for the theme callback.

column.name: type
column.remarks: Numeric representation of the type of the menu item, like MENU_LOCAL_TASK.

column.name: description
column.remarks: A description of this item.

column.name: position
column.remarks: The position of the block (left or right) on the system administration page for this item.

column.name: weight
column.remarks: Weight of the element. Lighter weights are higher up, heavier weights go down.

column.name: include_file
column.remarks: The file to include for this element, usually the page callback function lives in this file.

column.name: nid
column.remarks: The primary identifier for a node.

column.name: vid
column.remarks: The current node_revision.vid version identifier.

column.name: type
column.remarks: The node_type.type of this node.

column.name: language
column.remarks: The languages.language of this node.

column.name: title
column.remarks: The title of this node, always treated as non-markup plain text.

column.name: uid
column.remarks: The users.uid that owns this node; initially, this is the user that created it.

column.name: status
column.remarks: Boolean indicating whether the node is published (visible to non-administrators).

column.name: created
column.remarks: The Unix timestamp when the node was created.

column.name: changed
column.remarks: The Unix timestamp when the node was most recently saved.

column.name: comment
column.remarks: Whether comments are allowed on this node: 0 = no, 1 = closed (read only), 2 = open (read/write).

column.name: promote
column.remarks: Boolean indicating whether the node should be displayed on the front page.

column.name: sticky
column.remarks: Boolean indicating whether the node should be displayed at the top of lists in which it appears.

column.name: tnid
column.remarks: The translation set id for this node, which equals the node id of the source post in each set.

column.name: translate
column.remarks: A boolean indicating whether this translation page needs to be updated.

column.name: nid
column.remarks: The node.nid this record affects.

column.name: gid
column.remarks: The grant ID a user must possess in the specified realm to gain this row’s privileges on the node.

column.name: realm
column.remarks: The realm in which the user must possess the grant ID. Each node access node can define one or more realms.

column.name: grant_view
column.remarks: Boolean indicating whether a user with the realm/grant pair can view this node.

column.name: grant_update
column.remarks: Boolean indicating whether a user with the realm/grant pair can edit this node.

column.name: grant_delete
column.remarks: Boolean indicating whether a user with the realm/grant pair can delete this node.

column.name: nid
column.remarks: The node.nid for which the statistics are compiled.

column.name: cid
column.remarks: The comment.cid of the last comment.

column.name: last_comment_timestamp
column.remarks: The Unix timestamp of the last comment that was posted within this node, from comment.changed.

column.name: last_comment_name
column.remarks: The name of the latest author to post a comment on this node, from comment.name.

column.name: last_comment_uid
column.remarks: The user ID of the latest author to post a comment on this node, from comment.uid.

column.name: comment_count
column.remarks: The total number of comments on this node.

column.name: nid
column.remarks: The node this version belongs to.

column.name: vid
column.remarks: The primary identifier for this version.

column.name: uid
column.remarks: The users.uid that created this version.

column.name: title
column.remarks: The title of this version.

column.name: log
column.remarks: The log entry explaining the changes in this version.

column.name: timestamp
column.remarks: A Unix timestamp indicating when this version was created.

column.name: status
column.remarks: Boolean indicating whether the node (at the time of this revision) is published (visible to non-administrators).

column.name: comment
column.remarks: Whether comments are allowed on this node (at the time of this revision): 0 = no, 1 = closed (read only), 2 = open (read/write).

column.name: promote
column.remarks: Boolean indicating whether the node (at the time of this revision) should be displayed on the front page.

column.name: sticky
column.remarks: Boolean indicating whether the node (at the time of this revision) should be displayed at the top of lists in which it appears.

column.name: type
column.remarks: The machine-readable name of this type.

column.name: name
column.remarks: The human-readable name of this type.

column.name: base
column.remarks: The base string used to construct callbacks corresponding to this node type.

column.name: module
column.remarks: The module defining this node type.

column.name: description
column.remarks: A brief description of this type.

column.name: help
column.remarks: Help information shown to the user when creating a node of this type.

column.name: has_title
column.remarks: Boolean indicating whether this type uses the node.title field.

column.name: title_label
column.remarks: The label displayed for the title field on the edit form.

column.name: custom
column.remarks: A boolean indicating whether this type is defined by a module (FALSE) or by a user via Add content type (TRUE).

column.name: modified
column.remarks: A boolean indicating whether this type has been modified by an administrator; currently not used in any way.

column.name: locked
column.remarks: A boolean indicating whether the administrator can change the machine name of this type.

column.name: disabled
column.remarks: A boolean indicating whether the node type is disabled.

column.name: orig_type
column.remarks: The original machine-readable name of this node type. This may be different from the current type name if the locked field is 0.

column.name: item_id
column.remarks: Primary Key: Unique item ID.

column.name: name
column.remarks: The queue name.

column.name: data
column.remarks: The arbitrary data for the item.

column.name: expire
column.remarks: Timestamp when the claim lease expires on the item.

column.name: created
column.remarks: Timestamp when the item was created.

column.name: type
column.remarks: The name of the entity type a mapping applies to (node, user, comment, etc.).

column.name: bundle
column.remarks: The name of the bundle a mapping applies to.

column.name: mapping
column.remarks: The serialized mapping of the bundle type and fields to RDF terms.

column.name: name
column.remarks: The name of the function, class, or interface.

column.name: type
column.remarks: Either function or class or interface.

column.name: filename
column.remarks: Name of the file.

column.name: module
column.remarks: Name of the module the file belongs to.

column.name: weight
column.remarks: The order in which this module’s hooks should be invoked relative to other modules. Equal-weighted modules are ordered by name.

column.name: filename
column.remarks: Path to the file.

column.name: hash
column.remarks: sha-256 hash of the file’s contents when last parsed.

column.name: rid
column.remarks: Primary Key: Unique role ID.

column.name: name
column.remarks: Unique role name.

column.name: weight
column.remarks: The weight of this role in listings and the user interface.

column.name: rid
column.remarks: Foreign Key: role.rid.

column.name: permission
column.remarks: A single permission granted to the role identified by rid.

column.name: module
column.remarks: The module declaring the permission.

column.name: sid
column.remarks: Search item ID, e.g. node ID for nodes.

column.name: type
column.remarks: Type of item, e.g. node.

column.name: data
column.remarks: List of space-separated words from the item.

column.name: reindex
column.remarks: Set to force node reindexing.

column.name: word
column.remarks: The search_total.word that is associated with the search item.

column.name: sid
column.remarks: The search_dataset.sid of the searchable item to which the word belongs.

column.name: type
column.remarks: The search_dataset.type of the searchable item to which the word belongs.

column.name: score
column.remarks: The numeric score of the word, higher being more important.

column.name: sid
column.remarks: The search_dataset.sid of the searchable item containing the link to the node.

column.name: type
column.remarks: The search_dataset.type of the searchable item containing the link to the node.

column.name: nid
column.remarks: The node.nid that this item links to.

column.name: caption
column.remarks: The text used to link to the node.nid.

column.name: word
column.remarks: Primary Key: Unique word in the search index.

column.name: count
column.remarks: The count of the word in the index using Zipf’s law to equalize the probability distribution.

column.name: name
column.remarks: Primary Key: Unique name.

column.name: value
column.remarks: A value for the semaphore.

column.name: expire
column.remarks: A Unix timestamp with microseconds indicating when the semaphore should expire.

column.name: value
column.remarks: The value of the sequence.

column.name: uid
column.remarks: The users.uid corresponding to a session, or 0 for anonymous user.

column.name: sid
column.remarks: A session ID. The value is generated by Drupal’s session handlers.

column.name: ssid
column.remarks: Secure session ID. The value is generated by Drupal’s session handlers.

column.name: hostname
column.remarks: The IP address that last used this session ID (sid).

column.name: timestamp
column.remarks: The Unix timestamp when this session last requested a page. Old records are purged by PHP automatically.

column.name: cache
column.remarks: The time of this user’s last post. This is used when the site has specified a minimum_cache_lifetime. See cache_get().

column.name: session
column.remarks: The serialized contents of $_SESSION, an array of name/value pairs that persists across page requests by this session ID. Drupal loads $_SESSION from here at the start of each request and saves it at the end.

column.name: set_name
column.remarks: Primary Key: The menu_links.menu_name under which the set’s links are stored.

column.name: title
column.remarks: The title of the set.

column.name: uid
column.remarks: The users.uid for this set.

column.name: set_name
column.remarks: The shortcut_set.set_name that will be displayed for this user.

column.name: filename
column.remarks: The path of the primary file for this item, relative to the Drupal root; e.g. modules/node/node.module.

column.name: name
column.remarks: The name of the item; e.g. node.

column.name: type
column.remarks: The type of the item, either module, theme, or theme_engine.

column.name: owner
column.remarks: A theme’s ’parent’ . Can be either a theme or an engine.

column.name: status
column.remarks: Boolean indicating whether or not this item is enabled.

column.name: bootstrap
column.remarks: Boolean indicating whether this module is loaded during Drupal’s early bootstrapping phase (e.g. even before the page cache is consulted).

column.name: schema_version
column.remarks: The module’s database schema version number. -1 if the module is not installed (its tables do not exist); 0 or the largest N of the module’s hook_update_N() function that has either been run or existed when the module was first installed.

column.name: weight
column.remarks: The order in which this module’s hooks should be invoked relative to other modules. Equal-weighted modules are ordered by name.

column.name: info
column.remarks: A serialized array containing information from the module’s .info file; keys can include name, description, package, version, core, dependencies, and php.

column.name: nid
column.remarks: The node.nid this record tracks.

column.name: tid
column.remarks: The term ID.

column.name: sticky
column.remarks: Boolean indicating whether the node is sticky.

column.name: created
column.remarks: The Unix timestamp when the node was created.

column.name: tid
column.remarks: Primary Key: Unique term ID.

column.name: vid
column.remarks: The taxonomy_vocabulary.vid of the vocabulary to which the term is assigned.

column.name: name
column.remarks: The term name.

column.name: description
column.remarks: A description of the term.

column.name: format
column.remarks: The filter_format.format of the description.

column.name: weight
column.remarks: The weight of this term in relation to other terms.

column.name: tid
column.remarks: Primary Key: The taxonomy_term_data.tid of the term.

column.name: parent
column.remarks: Primary Key: The taxonomy_term_data.tid of the term’s parent. 0 indicates no parent.

column.name: vid
column.remarks: Primary Key: Unique vocabulary ID.

column.name: name
column.remarks: Name of the vocabulary.

column.name: machine_name
column.remarks: The vocabulary machine name.

column.name: description
column.remarks: Description of the vocabulary.

column.name: hierarchy
column.remarks: The type of hierarchy allowed within the vocabulary. (0 = disabled, 1 = single, 2 = multiple)

column.name: module
column.remarks: The module which created the vocabulary.

column.name: weight
column.remarks: The weight of this vocabulary in relation to other vocabularies.

column.name: pid
column.remarks: A unique path alias identifier.

column.name: source
column.remarks: The Drupal path this alias is for; e.g. node/12.

column.name: alias
column.remarks: The alias for this path; e.g. title-of-the-story.

column.name: language
column.remarks: The language this alias is for; if ’und’, the alias will be used for unknown languages. Each Drupal path can have an alias for each supported language.

column.name: uid
column.remarks: Primary Key: Unique user ID.

column.name: name
column.remarks: Unique user name.

column.name: pass
column.remarks: User’s password (hashed).

column.name: mail
column.remarks: User’s e-mail address.

column.name: theme
column.remarks: User’s default theme.

column.name: signature
column.remarks: User’s signature.

column.name: signature_format
column.remarks: The filter_format.format of the signature.

column.name: created
column.remarks: Timestamp for when user was created.

column.name: access
column.remarks: Timestamp for previous time user accessed the site.

column.name: login
column.remarks: Timestamp for user’s last login.

column.name: status
column.remarks: Whether the user is active(1) or blocked(0).

column.name: timezone
column.remarks: User’s time zone.

column.name: language
column.remarks: User’s default language.

column.name: picture
column.remarks: Foreign key: file_managed.fid of user’s picture.

column.name: init
column.remarks: E-mail address used for initial account creation.

column.name: data
column.remarks: A serialized array of name value pairs that are related to the user. Any form values posted during user edit are stored and are loaded into the $user object during user_load(). Use of this field is discouraged and it will likely disappear in a future...

column.name: uid
column.remarks: Primary Key: users.uid for user.

column.name: rid
column.remarks: Primary Key: role.rid for role.

column.name: name
column.remarks: The name of the variable.

column.name: value
column.remarks: The value of the variable.

column.name: name
column.remarks: The name of the variable.

column.name: value
column.remarks: The value of the variable.

addPrimaryKey.columnNames: entity_type, entity_id, revision_id, deleted, delta, language
entity_type, entity_id, revision_id, deleted, delta, language
entity_type, entity_id, revision_id, deleted, delta, language
entity_type, entity_id, revision_id, deleted, delta, language
